content: 10 15 20 eyelets now for a bit of straight knitting … knit 10 16 20 row decreasing every row k to the last 2 sts k2tog repeat this row until you are down to three stitches and then cast off with the double decrease cast off sl 1 kwise k2tog psso and fasten_off leaving a long tail that cast off tail will be used to sew the pouch together you can darn in the other tail 3 this is what your finished piece should look like knit three more pieces like this and then you are ready to assemble your pouch sewing it together holding the wrong sides together oversew / whipstitch two pieces together start at the cast off points and finish with just one stitch through the ends of the first row in the petal colour add the remaining sections in the same way and this is what your finished pouch should look like 4 adding the drawstrings i used either thick yarn or thin ribbon for my drawstrings adding some pony beads to the ends of each of them cut two lengths of about 60 - 72 cm / 24 - 30 depending on the size of the pouch if in doubt cut more you can trim any excess later starting at one of the joins thread one of the strings in and out of each hole all the way round the pouch both ends will come out of the same hole now thread the other string through starting from the hole on the opposite side and going in and out in the same places as the first string this means that this second string will start and finish on the inside of the pouch rather than the outside knot the ends of each string together adding a few beads first and trim the ends if necessary you can really fit all sorts of things in these little pouches © frankie brown 2024 5 abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl kf&b knit into the front and back of the stitch yf yarn forward as if to purl k2tog knit two stitches together sl 1 kwise slip one stitch knitwise psso pass slipped stitch over © frankie brown 2024 mypatterns areforpersonaluseonlyandshouldnotbeusedtoknititems forsale pleasedonotusethemforteachingpurposes withoutmypermission 6
